definition: cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]
short name for Chahar Province 察哈爾|察哈尔[Cha2 ha1 er3]
to examine/to inquire/to observe/to inspect/to look into/obvious/clearly evident

sentences.english: Thinking critically can enable one to analyze problems insightfully.
sentences.chinese: 批判性思考能夠使你在分析問題時富有洞察力。

sentences.english: Nothing is more terrible than activity without insight.
sentences.chinese: 最可帕的事莫如做任何活動，沒有洞察力。

sentences.english: For the vision of one man lends not its wings to another man.
sentences.chinese: 因爲一個人的洞察力不能將其羽翼借給另一個人。

sentences.english: Discernment and analysis must lead to conclusions and ideas.
sentences.chinese: 洞察力和分析一定要產生結論和想法。

sentences.english: Precognition is a form of clairvoyance.
sentences.chinese: 預知是超人的洞察力的一種形式。

sentences.english: He was a man of deep insight.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個很有洞察力的人。

sentences.english: His painting rose to a expressive ness and revealed a shrewder insight.
sentences.chinese: 他的畫富有一種新的表達力顯示出更敏銳的洞察力。

sentences.english: Focusing with perfect discipline on the polestar yields insight about their movements.
sentences.chinese: 對於北極星的專注可以獲得對於其運動的洞察。

sentences.english: An umpire must be an entirely disinterested but keen observer.
sentences.chinese: 一個裁判員必須公正無私而且具有敏銳的洞察力。

sentences.english: A politician has to have good insight as well as common sense.
sentences.chinese: 一個政治家一定要有洞察力及常識。

sentences.english: It appears your perceptive powers know no bounds.
sentences.chinese: 看來妳得洞察力真是不可限量呢。

sentences.english: Yet spouses do not lack insight.
sentences.chinese: 然而配偶們並不缺乏洞察力。

sentences.english: Get some rest. It would recharge your energy levels and ensure you put things in perspective.
sentences.chinese: 休息會讓你重新精力充沛，並且確保你洞察一切。

sentences.english: The second chapter analyzed the external factors of music's genres changes.
sentences.chinese: 第三章因情立體，洞察音樂體裁流變的中介因素。

sentences.english: The great God, opened the eyes of your insight into all.
sentences.chinese: 偉大的神，睜開你的眼睛洞察一切。

sentences.english: For example, Quelch emphasized that insight into the customer is still a key driver of innovation.
sentences.chinese: 例如，奎爾奇強調洞察客戶心理仍是創新的主要動力。

definition: clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
to understand thoroughly/to see beyond the facade/to see through (sb)
to sense/to perceive/to come to realize/to be aware
to pry into or spy on/to snoop/to peep/to poke one's nose into/to peer/to get a glimpse of
to analyze/to try to figure out/to try to fathom
